snippet: Colombia’s largest guerrilla group declared on Wednesday that it was about to begin an indefinite, unilateral cease-fire, in a challenge to the government to halt hostilities while the two sides continued negotiations toward an end to 50 years of...
abstract: Revolutionary Armed Forces of Colombia announces it is about to begin indefinite, unilateral cease-fire in challenge to government to suspend hostilities while both sides make attempt to broker permanent peace; group warns that it will call off cease-fire if government forces attack during period of negotation.

byline.contributor: Susan Abad contributed reporting from Bogotá, Colombia.

lead_paragraph: Colombia’s largest guerrilla group declared on Wednesday that it was about to begin an indefinite, unilateral cease-fire, in a challenge to the government to halt hostilities while the two sides continued negotiations toward an end to 50 years of war.
